Class DatabaseManager

java.lang.Object
DatabaseManager
public class DatabaseManager extends Object
Manages all SQLite database interactions for the Restaurant DMS project.

Responsibilities:

  • Establish and close JDBC connections (via two overloads of connect).
  • Initialize schema (create tables if absent).
  • Fetch all records for GUI wiring.
  • Perform CRUD operations on employees and dishes.
  • Compute payroll reports directly from the database.

This class uses a single static Connection instance, which is reused for all database operations and closed explicitly when no longer needed.

      public DatabaseManager()

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public static void connect()
      Prompt-based connect (SQLite only). Loops until a valid file path is given. Uses Scanner to read console input—intended for CLI testing.

    • connect

      public static void connect(String filePath) throws SQLException
      Direct connect for a given SQLite file path (no reprompt). Automatically initializes tables upon successful connection.
      Parameters:
      filePath - path to the .db file (must not be blank)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if connection fails or path is invalid

    • disconnect

      public static void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the database if a connection is open. Safe to call multiple times.

    • getConnection

      public static Connection getConnection()
      Retrieves the active JDBC Connection, or null if not connected.
      Returns:
      the Connection instance (or null)

    • getAllEmployees

      public static List<Employee> getAllEmployees() throws SQLException
      Fetches all employees from the database into a List of Employee objects.
      Returns:
      List of Employee instances populated from the 'employees' table
      Throws:
      SQLException - if query execution fails

    • getAllDishes

      public static List<Dish> getAllDishes() throws SQLException
      Fetches all dishes from the database.
      Returns:
      List of Dish objects (with their database‐assigned IDs)
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs

    • addEmployeeToDB

      public static void addEmployeeToDB(String name, double hoursWorked, double hourlyRate)
      Inserts a new employee into the database.
      Parameters:
      name - the employee's name
      hoursWorked - total hours worked
      hourlyRate - hourly pay rate

    • addDishToDB

      public static void addDishToDB(String name, double price)
      Inserts a new dish into the database.
      Parameters:
      name - the dish name
      price - the dish price

    • removeEmployeeFromDB

      public static void removeEmployeeFromDB(int id)
      Deletes an employee by their database row ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the employee to delete

    • removeDishFromDB

      public static void removeDishFromDB(int id)
      Deletes a dish by its database row ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the dish to delete

    • updateEmployeeInDB

      public static void updateEmployeeInDB(int id, String field, String newValue)
      Updates a single column of an existing employee.
      Parameters:
      id - the employee ID
      field - the column name ("name", "hoursWorked", or "hourlyRate")
      newValue - the new value (parsed as DOUBLE if numeric)

    • updateDishInDB

      public static void updateDishInDB(int id, String field, String newValue)
      Updates a single column of a dish in the SQLite database.

      This method dynamically builds and executes an SQL update statement to modify either the name or price field of a dish, using the provided dish ID and new value.

      Parameters:
      id - the unique ID of the dish to update
      field - the column name to update ("name" or "price")
      newValue - the new value to apply; parsed as double if updating price

    • calculateTotalPayrollFromDB

      public static void calculateTotalPayrollFromDB()
      Generates and prints a payroll report using employee data from the database.

      For each employee, this method retrieves their name, hours worked, and hourly rate, calculates their weekly pay, and prints the results to the console. At the end, it prints the total payroll for all employees.
